thread.section_title: Science News and Analysis - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: Virginia’s Unhappy Hour

author: The Editorial Board
title: Virginia’s Unhappy Hour
text:
If beer is proof that God loves us and wants us to be happy, then Virginia’s happy hour restrictions don’t bode well for the government’s benevolence. The state’s strict prohibitions violate the First Amendment, restaurateur Geoff Tracy claims in a lawsuit against the Virginia Alcoholic Beverage Control Authority filed last week in federal court in Alexandria.
Mr. Tracy owns three restaurants around Washington, D.C., and outside Virginia he can advertise colorful happy hours like Wednesday Wine Night, Thirsty Thursday, and...
